title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Water Utility Energy Efficiency Technical Assistance, through Resource Mobilization Advisors

description.narrative: The objective of the Water Utility Energy Efficiency Technical Assistance is to provide recommendations to El Salvadors National Administration of Aqueducts and Sewers (Administracion Nacional de Acueductos y Alcantarillados, ANDA) for efficiency measures that would lead to significant cost savings, develop a third-party financing model for the upgrades and energy efficiency projects, and explore the viability of onsite renewable power generation.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Comalapa International Passenger Terminal, through Government of El Salvador

description.narrative: The $427,569 El Salvador Comalapa International Passenger Terminal Feasibility Study is developing the specifications for passenger terminal improvements at El Salvador's largest airport. The project would support the Obama Administration's Partnership for Growth (PFG) initiative with El Salvador.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Ilopango-Aguacayo Hydropower, through Government of El Salvador

description.narrative: This $742,380 Ilopango-Aguacayo Hydropower Feasibility Study is supporting the development of a 17 megawatt (MW) hydropower facility on Lake Ilopango in El Salvador. The project would provide a reliable supply of renewable energy, while at the same time helping to control periodic flooding of the lake's surrounding areas. The Ilopango - Aguacayo Hydropower Project is a high priority project that would support the Obama Administration's Energy and Climate Partnership of the Americas and the Partnership for Growth initiative with El Salvador.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Jiboa River Hydropower Plants, through Americas Energy Services, LLC

description.narrative: This feasibility study will help INGENDEHSA, S.A. de C.V. to develop two small run-of-river hydroelectric projects in El Salvador totaling 13.3 megawatts of installed capacity. The projects will be located along the Jiboa River approximately 50 kilometers east of San Salvador. These projects support the goals of the Clean Energy Finance Facility for the Caribbean and Central America.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - CEL Solar Photovoltaic Power Pilot Project, through Government of El Salvador

description.narrative: This $267,000 feasibility study grant for the CEL Solar Photovoltaic Power Pilot Project helps El Salvador's national energy utility (Comision Ejecutiva Hidroelectrica del Rio Lempa, CEL) to develop a 3 MW grid-connected solar photovoltaic power generation pilot project in El Salvador. The CEL Solar Power Pilot Project supports the Energy and Climate Partnership of the Americas, the Central American Renewable Energy Forum, and the Partnership for Growth.
